title: Cannot change color of tabs
content:
Hello I had Firefox version 81 and after installing version 82 in a new install on a new hard drive, I cannot change the color of my tabs anymore.

I should see white tabs for the current tab but no longer. Question: Is this been blocked now?

I see instead a thin blue color strip along the top of the tab and the rest is grey. This shows up without any userChrome file.

about:support shows my Profile. vwy0y5ix.default-release I also have under the Profile folder this: jcueuz5y.default

Question: Why 2 profiles now as I had only one before? See attachments.

I put the userChrome.css file here in the Chrome folder: C:\Users\David\AppData\Roaming\Mozilla\Firefox\Profiles\vwy0y5ix.default-release

What it contains:

  1. nav-bar { -moz-box-ordinal-group: 1 !important; }
  2. PersonalToolbar { -moz-box-ordinal-group: 2 !important; }
  3. TabsToolbar { -moz-box-ordinal-group: 3 !important; }

.tab-background:not([selected]) { 

   background-color: #E3E0DB !important;

}

.tab-background[selected="true"] { 

   background-color: white!important;
creator: davidhelp

title: firefox start up
content: when I click on the firefox icon, it asks to download changes to my computer. Upon clicking 'yes' it just reverts back to the same pop up
creator: gkirk1966

title: Open PDFs without editing them?
content:
It appears firefox just rolled out an update that allows you to fill-out/edit PDFs, which is great except for the fact that there seems to be no way to go back to the standard viewer.

The editor broke my PDFs, text is missing in fields, some other text is overlaid on top of other and overall its quite a terrible experience. I am certain that this will be fixed over time, but is there any way to go back on the meantime?

No images attached since all the PDF documents I edit have some degree of private/confidential information.
creator: gd58hugo

title: MS Bing is now taking over firefox.  It looses all my temp tabs in the tab menu and forces its search engine onto my computer.
content:
MS has begun 'grabbing' my FF browser - does this about once a week. It closes my tabs, kills my search engine and substitutes bing. This, I assume, is malware from MS and may have come in with the new Windows 10:

First - I want to make Mozilla aware this is happening.

Second - how can I prevent those bastards from grabbing the browser and making me re-install my tabs - all this takes about a half hour?

Thanks,

DMS
creator: rangerdon

title: Website link missing
content: I was trying to download a new driver for my laptop but the link to each of the 'zip' files dont work, these work on Chrome. The 'popular link' works but none of the others. The link address usually appears on the bottom left of the page when hovered over but doesnt on these This is the website https://support.dynabook.com/support/modelHome?freeText=1200008317&osId=3333785 I have used this site on many occasions previously. Any ideas?
creator: AussieDenis
